newsitem.title: CANADA: Videotron to reduce debt to C$400 mln.
newsitem.headline: Videotron to reduce debt to C$400 mln.

text.p: Groupe Videotron Ltee said on Tuesday that the sale of its 56 percent interest in Videotron Holdings Plc will reduce its debt level to about C$400 million.

Videotron agreed to sell its stake in Videotron Holdings, which owns its U.K. cable assets to Bell Cablemedia Plc for C$825 million ($600 million) or the equivalent of $19.75 per American Depository Share (ADS).
Not including about C$600 million of Videotron Holdings debt consolidated at Groupe Videotron, the Canadian parent's debt level is currently about C$1.2 billion.

Alain Michel, Groupe Videotron's chief financial officer, told reporters at a press conference that the company has yet to decide precisely how it will use the proceeds of the sale of its U.K. operations. But, on a pro forma basis, the transaction will reduce the company's debt level to about C$400 million.
That figure does not include a C$300 million debenture related to Videotron's acquisition of CFCF Inc earlier this year.
Videotron's objective is to have a long-term debt level of about three times cash flow.
"It will be the least indebted cable company in North America," said Claude Chagnon, vice-chairman of Groupe Videotron.
